Ansell Guardian® Partner Resources

Ansell Guardian® Partner Resources

Find answers to the most frequently asked questions or watch our video to find out more about how you can benefit from Ansell Guardian ® Partner

1

What are the main benefits of Ansell Guardian ® Partner?

Your workers will enjoy an optimal solution and will be equipped with the right PPE solution. In addition to that, we can help companies to improve their productivity and cost performance.
2

How can I get more information about the Ansell Guardian ® Partner programme?

You can contact us by following this link. Weâ€™ll revert to you within 48 hours.
3

Why do I need to log in?

You need to log in In order to be able to access to extended functionalities such as download,personalise and email your chemical reports.
4

What are the differences between basic, advanced and personalised access?

Basic will grant quick access to chemical permeation data for both hand and body protection solutions. The advanced module will enable you to personalise, download and email your chemical permeation reports. A personalised on-site assessment can be conducted by one of our Ansell Guardian specialist in order to understand your safety needs and business performance requirements.
5

How do I find the right protection solution for an individual set of chemicals?

The process starts with a risk assessment in your specific applications. Ansell Guardian Partner helps you to visualize expected permeation breakthrough times and/degradation levels for the chemicals used versus a selection of gloves. You will be able to see which PPE materials are more appropriate for your set of chemicals, and which materials are less likely to work. From there, you can start selecting gloves that match other selection criteria in your application, such as dexterity, heat resistance, mechanical resistance and so forth. Bear in mind that the shown chemical resistance data are based on theoretical lab test results or extrapolations and estimations and might not take into account all factors for your specific application (such as mechanical stress on your PPE, temperature, length of exposure, â€¦.).
6

What do the different colours in the lists of chemical permeation data mean?

We have linked colours to the permeation breakthrough time levels defined by the specific standards. Please refer to the legend to have an overview of the permeation breakthrough time levels and the assigned colours.
7

How many chemicals (and their corresponding permeation data) can be combined in the lists?

There is no limit as to how many chemicals can be combined in your list. There can be 20 glove styles combined in your list, however you can add or delete anytime and so come to the selection most suitable for your specific application.
8

Are there other ways to search for a suitable product than by chemical name or Chemical Abstracts Service (CAS) number?

We use the two most common ways to define a chemical: its most common way and the CAS number. Indeed, chemicals can have several synonyms for which most common synonyms are also added in the search option. Other systems than CAS do exists, however CAS is the only globally used system to identify all groups of chemicals.
